intro: Capuronianthus mahafalensis, commonly known as the Mahafaly starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, round fruits that are typically consumed by local wildlife. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
